title: 'Some of the greatest computer scientists in US are of Indian origin,' Stanford Professor says at AI Summit 2026
description: India is set to retain its top tech talent and foster its own artificial intelligence capabilities. Surya Ganguli, a Stanford expert, highlights the significant contributions of Indian-origin scientists in the US. He believes India's young population possesses immense talent. The nation is now positioned to grow sovereign AI. Sensible regulation is encouraged to support innovation without stifling it.

title: India is betting big on data centres but is this the best path to success with artificial intelligence?
description: A proliferation of data centres may serve some purposes, but it's unlikely to help India achieve AI sovereignty. That path is far steeper. We need homegrown AI chips, original models and actual innovation based on first principles. Being the world’s data storage or processing hub won’t get us far.
content:
For hardware, we should indigenize AI chip design, fabrication, assembly and testing; and for software, we should create our own AI models. This is the only way to guard against being at the mercy of foreign suppliers.
That we form a vast market for ... [2845 chars]
